result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J. Stelter

records.addlTxt:
1:49 PM Defendant Joshua J. Stelter appeared by zoom technology by video along with counsel, Nicholis Schroeder by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Schroeder requests to adjourn to get an attorney appointed and withhold entering a plea at this time.  Defendant confirms his address on file.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Correspondence from SPD that Mr. Stelter qualifies for representation.  No objection by DA to setting a new court date.

1:50 PM Defendant Joshua J. Stelter fails to appear for AIA.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. On 9/20/22 he appeared by zoom technology, Mr. Raymond was on the call and confirmed Mr. Stelter would be appointed Mr. Rivard if he contacted the PD office and qualified for services.  Mr. Schroeder unaware if he contacted the PD and no information for his FTA.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the Court.  If the PD has additional information, court will not sign the warrant and allow until Friday at noon.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:48 PM Defendant Joshua J. Stelter appeared by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Stelter previously appeared.  On 9/6 you mentioned Attorney Rivard was your attorney but he has not filed anything with the Court.  Mr. Raymond is on the call.  Mr. Raymond asks to adjourn to allow time for Mr. Stelter call the PD office and apply and if eligible, will appoint Mr. Rivard.  Defendant confirms his address on file. 22FO21 7 day warrant letter mailed.  Mr. Stelter requests a PP.  Court set $50/mo. com. 11/1.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:00 PM Defendant Joshua J. Stelter appeared by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Stelter assumed his attorney in Chippewa County would pick up this case.  His attorney is Fran Rivard.  Mr. Schroeder of SPD informs Mr. Stelter he needs to reapply for SPD.  Mr. Stelter will call after finished here.  Mr. Schroeder suggests 9/20 next court date.  Zoom approved.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  It appears there was also a non criminal matter.  Contact the COC for payments for that matter.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with T.W. or his residence.

12:45 PM Defendant Joshua J. Stelter appeared by zoom technology by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Stetler had a summons to appear on 8/2, he failed to appear and appears today pursuant to that warrant.  The warrant is now quashed.  Court advised defendant of charges, penalties and rights.  State understands that Mr. Stelter communicated with the COC on his own accord and given the circumstances the State has no objection to continue the signature bond but add no contact with victim TW.  Mr. Stelter doesn't know who TW is but know where he lives and has no objection.  No contact with TW or his residence and order signature bond of $500.00.  Contact the PD office and if not eligible Court would consider appointing an attorney.  Contact the COC if not eligible.You would repay the county on a payment plan of $100/mo.  Defendant confirms his mailing address.  The COC will mail you the bond form
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:12 PM Defendant Joshua J. Stelter not in court.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Stelter signed a signature bond and then was summoned to appear today at 1:30 and it is now 2:12 pm.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the Court for failure to appear.
